data.prompt:
You are an aspect categorization specialist.

**YOUR TASK:** Categorize performance aspects into the most appropriate categories from the provided taxonomy.

**UNDERSTANDING THE DATA:**
- Each aspect represents customer feedback about different product functionality and operational characteristics
- Categorize each aspect into the most appropriate category
- Use "OUT_OF_SCOPE" for aspects that don't fit well into any category
- Focus on business value and customer impact when making assignments

**AVAILABLE CATEGORIES:**
**AVAILABLE CATEGORIES:**
[C_0] Smart Home Integration: Aspects related to connecting and syncing switches with smart home systems, apps, and wireless protocols, e.g. Philips Hue app connectivity, HomeKit pairing, Zigbee bridge compatibility
[C_1] Operational Reliability: Aspects concerning consistent day-to-day performance and dependability of switch operation, e.g. always working when activated, consistent response, no operational problems
[C_2] Dimming Performance: Aspects specifically about the quality and effectiveness of light dimming capabilities, e.g. smooth dimming operation, precise brightness control, full dimming range
[C_3] Customization Capabilities: Aspects related to personalizing switch functions, scenes, and automation features, e.g. button customization, scene programming, home automation setup
[C_4] Installation Process: Aspects concerning the ease and complexity of physically installing and wiring the switch, e.g. straightforward installation, wiring requirements, setup complexity
[C_5] Device Compatibility: Aspects about how well switches work with different bulb types, electrical configurations, and equipment, e.g. LED bulb compatibility, wattage ratings, multi-way setups
[C_6] Build Quality: Aspects related to the physical construction quality and materials of the switch, e.g. sturdy construction, high-quality materials, well-built components
[C_7] Product Durability: Aspects concerning the long-term physical integrity and lifespan of the switch, e.g. resistance to breaking, longevity over years, structural failure resistance
[C_8] Core Functionality: Aspects about basic switch operations like turning lights on/off and maintaining proper electrical function, e.g. reliable switching, maintaining connections, basic electrical performance
[C_9] Visual Appearance: Aspects related to the aesthetic design and visual integration of the switch, e.g. matching decor, attractive design, color coordination
[C_10] Fan Control Performance: Aspects specifically about controlling ceiling fan speed and operation, e.g. fan speed adjustment, fan motor control, fan-specific functionality
[C_11] Light Control Performance: Aspects about controlling light brightness levels and maintaining lighting consistency, e.g. brightness maintenance, light level control, illumination management
[C_12] Flickering Issues: Aspects specifically about unwanted light flickering problems and visual disturbances, e.g. LED flickering, intermittent light fluctuation, strobe effects
[C_13] Noise Issues: Aspects concerning unwanted sounds produced by the switch during operation, e.g. buzzing sounds, humming noise, quiet operation
[C_14] Response Time: Aspects about the speed of switch response when activated, e.g. immediate activation, delay between input and response, lag time
[C_15] Adjustability Features: Aspects about fine-tuning and calibration options for switch performance, e.g. minimum level adjustment, sensitivity settings, operational parameters
[C_16] Product Value: Aspects concerning the cost-effectiveness and worth of the switch relative to its features, e.g. price-to-feature ratio, value proposition, cost justification
[C_17] Advanced Features: Aspects about special or enhanced capabilities beyond basic switching, e.g. memory functions, timed shutoff, brightness range, connectivity options
[C_18] User Experience: Aspects about the overall ease and intuitiveness of using the switch, e.g. user-friendly operation, learning curve, operational simplicity
[C_19] Electrical Safety: Aspects concerning electrical hazards and safety incidents with the switch, e.g. overheating, electrical failures, safety malfunctions
[C_20] OUT_OF_SCOPE: Aspects that are too vague, generic, or unclear to categorize meaningfully
[C_21] Basic Switch Operation: Core on/off switching functionality and basic operational performance, e.g. switch not working, functions as expected, works perfectly
[C_22] Product Longevity: How long products continue to function before failure or degradation, e.g. failed after months, lasted years, stopped working
[C_23] Light Flickering: Issues with lights flickering or strobing during operation, e.g. bulbs flicker when dimming, flicker-free operation
[C_24] Smart Connectivity: Performance of wireless connections and smart home integrations, e.g. works with Alexa, lost WiFi connection, pairing issues
[C_25] Bulb Compatibility: How well switches work with different types of light bulbs and fixtures, e.g. works with LEDs, incompatible with smart bulbs
[C_26] Operational Noise: Sound levels during switch operation including buzzing and humming, e.g. silent operation, buzzing noise, electrical sounds
[C_27] Response Timing: Speed and consistency of switch activation and response, e.g. delayed response, works sporadically, immediate activation
[C_28] Heat Management: Temperature control and overheating issues during operation, e.g. gets hot during use, overheating shutdowns
[C_29] Remote Control Range: Effective operating distance for wireless remote functionality, e.g. works at 30 feet, spotty signal at close range
[C_30] Memory and Timer Features: Advanced functionality like remembering settings and scheduling capabilities, e.g. returns to last level, timer doesn't allow dimming
[C_31] Installation Experience: Ease and success of physical installation process, e.g. easy installation, installation difficulties, falls apart during install
[C_32] Signal Quality: Wireless signal strength and interference issues affecting performance, e.g. metal box interference, receiver orientation affects performance
[C_33] Indicator Visibility: Clarity and brightness of status lights and visual indicators, e.g. pilot light too dim, hard to see in daylight
[C_34] Purchase Value: Customer perception of cost-effectiveness and worth relative to price paid, e.g. good value for money, worth the price
[C_35] Basic Functionality: Core operational performance of switches including on/off operation, general working condition, and fundamental switch behavior, e.g. works great, not working, malfunctioning, defective
[C_36] Device Pairing: Process of connecting and syncing switches with controllers, hubs, or wireless systems, e.g. paired straight away, pairing is extremely difficult, switch synced quickly
[C_37] Wireless Connectivity: Stability and reliability of wireless connections including WiFi, Zigbee, and network connectivity issues, e.g. go offline regularly, connected easily, disconnects frequently
[C_38] Smart Integration: Compatibility and functionality with smart home systems, voice assistants, and automation platforms, e.g. works with SmartThings Hub, integrates with Alexa, no double-tap automations
[C_39] Physical Fit: How well switches fit with wall plates, switch boxes, and existing electrical configurations, e.g. prevents switch plate covers from laying flat, saves space in switch box, fits in existing canopy
[C_40] Long Term Durability: Reliability and performance over extended periods of use including failure rates and longevity, e.g. working great for few years, failed after six months, rock solid system
[C_41] Wireless Range: Distance capabilities and signal strength for wireless communication between switches and controllers, e.g. works 200 feet away, barely made it to house, excellent range
[C_42] Response Speed: Quickness of switch response to commands and input including activation delay, e.g. light turns on instantly without delay, quickly turns light off/on
[C_43] Wire Connection: Quality and reliability of electrical wire connections and termination methods, e.g. secure wire connection, eliminates need for wire bending, concern about push-in connection reliability
[C_44] Thermal Management: How well the switch handles heat generation during operation, e.g. temperature control during high wattage loads, overheating prevention
[C_45] Multi Way Configuration: Ability to work in different wiring configurations beyond single pole, e.g. 3-way, 4-way switch applications
[C_46] Basic Operation: Core on/off switching functionality and general performance, e.g. turning lights on and off, basic switch operation
[C_47] Control Precision: Accuracy and responsiveness of dimming adjustments and settings, e.g. fine-tuning dimmer levels, sensitivity of controls
[C_48] Physical Controls: Tactile experience and mechanical operation of buttons, switches, and sliders, e.g. button pressure, switch action feel, control responsiveness
[C_49] Dimming Quality: Performance of light level adjustment including smoothness and range, e.g. dimming range, flickering issues, brightness control accuracy
[C_50] Power Capacity: Ability to handle specified electrical loads and wattage requirements, e.g. maximum wattage handling, load capacity performance
[C_51] Smart Features: Mobile app functionality and software-based controls, e.g. app interface, customization options, software reliability
[C_52] Network Integration: Wireless connectivity and smart home platform compatibility, e.g. WiFi stability, HomeKit support, Matter compatibility
[C_53] Electrical Reliability: Consistency of electrical connections and power delivery, e.g. connection stability, intermittent operation, electrical contact quality
[C_54] Visual Design: Aesthetic appearance and visual integration with other devices, e.g. color matching, design consistency, visual appeal
[C_55] Indicator Lighting: Built-in LED indicators and night light functionality, e.g. status lights, night light brightness, automatic lighting features
[C_56] Operational Sound: Noise levels and sound characteristics during switch operation, e.g. clicking sounds, operational noise, sound consistency
[C_57] Manufacturing Consistency: Uniformity and quality control across multiple units, e.g. defect rates, unit-to-unit variation, packaging quality
[C_58] Installation Ease: How straightforward and simple the physical installation process is for customers, e.g. easy to install, fits in existing switch box, compatible with three-way circuits
[C_59] Dimming Range Control: The ability to smoothly adjust light brightness across the full spectrum from very dim to maximum brightness, e.g. great dimming range, dims all the way down properly, limited to 75% maximum brightness
[C_60] LED Flickering Issues: Problems or solutions related to LED light flickering when used with dimmer switches, e.g. prevents LED flickering, causes lights to flicker, flickering with dimmable bulbs
[C_61] Physical Switch Operation: How the physical switch mechanism functions including smoothness, clicking, and positioning, e.g. smooth operation, switches won't toggle into place, won't click fully into position
[C_62] WiFi Connectivity: Network connection stability and reliability for smart switches, e.g. stays connected to WiFi, drops network connection daily, can't connect out of the box
[C_63] Electrical Noise: Audible buzzing or humming sounds produced during operation, e.g. no buzzing with LED bulbs, LEDs buzz when dimmed, quiet operation
[C_64] Power Control Accuracy: Precise delivery and control of electrical power to connected lights, e.g. not sending power despite connection, won't turn lights all the way off, works as advertised
[C_65] Switch Position Stability: Ability of switches to maintain their set position without unwanted movement, e.g. switches don't stay in set position, automatically flip back to off, randomly turn themselves off
[C_66] Bulb Type Compatibility: How well the switch works with different types of light bulbs and technologies, e.g. works with various LED bulb types, picky about brand of bulb, LED technology compatibility
[C_67] Touch Interface Responsiveness: Customer feedback specifically about touch-based control sensitivity and ease of use, e.g. very responsive to touch, takes practice to get used to, not as easy to finely control as slider
[C_68] Timer Functionality: Performance of built-in timer features for controlling connected devices like fans or lights, e.g. bottom switch is timer, fan timer works great, runs fan with timer button
[C_69] Electrical Performance: Technical electrical operation including noise, buzzing, hesitation, and power delivery characteristics, e.g. no hum, buzz when switched on, hesitates when turning on, performs well
[C_70] Memory and Recovery Features: How well the switch remembers settings and recovers from power interruptions, e.g. won't remember last dimmer setting, normally OFF after power cycle, hub takes minutes to come back online
[C_71] Remote Control Performance: Effectiveness and reliability of wireless remote control functionality, e.g. pico remote working 35-40% of the time, remote is useless, repeaters have limited range
[C_72] Software Experience: User experience with setup software, apps, and installation guidance, e.g. terrible software experience, showing countless errors, worst install experience
[C_73] Electrical Stability: Consistent electrical operation without unwanted effects like buzzing, flashing, or flickering during normal use, e.g. no buzzing sounds, no light flashing, stable power delivery
[C_74] Heat Generation: Amount of heat produced during operation and thermal management effectiveness, e.g. running cool, excessive heating, normal warmth levels
[C_75] Load Compatibility: Ability to work properly with different types and capacities of lighting loads, e.g. LED compatibility, high wattage handling, fluorescent support
[C_76] Touch Responsiveness: Physical button and touch interface response quality and reliability, e.g. responsive touch controls, unresponsive buttons, erratic operation
[C_77] Mobile App Experience: Quality and usability of companion mobile applications for device control and setup, e.g. easy app setup, app functionality issues, user interface quality
[C_78] Overall Reliability: General dependability and consistent performance across all basic functions over time, e.g. works flawlessly, consistent operation, general functionality
[C_79] Network Connectivity: Aspects related to establishing and maintaining WiFi connections, pairing with routers, and network stability, e.g. WiFi connection drops, pairing difficulties, router compatibility
[C_80] Installation Requirements: Aspects concerning physical installation challenges, space constraints, and wiring requirements, e.g. tight switchbox fit, ground wire requirements, installation complexity
[C_81] Multi Location Control: Aspects related to controlling lights from multiple switch locations and 3-way or 4-way configurations, e.g. 3-way setup issues, multi-location dimming capability
[C_82] Light Flickering Issues: Aspects concerning unwanted light flickering behavior with various bulb types and dimming levels, e.g. LED flickering at low brightness, flicker elimination
[C_83] Electrical Interference: Aspects concerning unwanted electrical effects on other devices or circuits, e.g. circuit interference, harmonic issues, noise generation
[C_84] Power Sensitivity: Aspects related to how switches respond to power fluctuations, outages, and electrical variations, e.g. power fluctuation damage, startup issues after outages
[C_85] Privacy and Data: Aspects related to data collection, storage location, and privacy permissions required by smart switches, e.g. invasive app permissions, data stored in foreign countries
[C_86] Fade Transition Effects: Aspects concerning smooth lighting transitions during turn-on and turn-off operations, e.g. fade-out effects, ramp-down functionality, delayed shut-off features
[C_87] Physical Switch Quality: Performance aspects related to the tactile feel and mechanical operation of physical switch components, e.g. button action quality, rocker switch feel, switching force
[C_88] Response Performance: Performance aspects related to speed and reliability of device response to commands, e.g. command execution delay, response consistency
[C_89] LED Compatibility: Performance aspects related to proper functioning with LED lighting systems, e.g. LED bulb compatibility, lighting performance with LEDs
[C_90] Signal Range: Performance aspects related to wireless communication distance and signal strength, e.g. connection range limitations, signal reliability at distance
[C_91] Multi-Way Switching: Performance aspects related to 3-way switch functionality and multi-switch configurations, e.g. 3-way operation, multiple switch recognition
[C_92] Power Management: Performance aspects related to power handling and electrical performance, e.g. power outage recovery, voltage sensitivity, current handling
[C_93] Indicator Light Performance: Performance aspects related to built-in indicator or pilot light functionality, e.g. indicator brightness, pilot light operation
[C_94] Humidity Detection Accuracy: How effectively the product senses humidity levels and responds appropriately to environmental moisture changes, e.g. detecting humidity at 65%, activating during showers, false triggering issues
[C_95] Timer Operation: How well automated timing functions work to control device operation duration and scheduling, e.g. 20-minute auto shutoff, hourly cycling, re-sensing capabilities
[C_96] Light Flickering Control: The product's ability to prevent or cause unwanted light flickering across different bulb types and fixtures, e.g. eliminating LED flicker, causing fixture interference, maintaining steady illumination
[C_97] Dimming Range Performance: How effectively the product controls light brightness levels across the full dimming spectrum, e.g. smooth transitions, maintaining low levels, dimming range limitations
[C_98] Switch Response Time: How quickly the product responds to user inputs and commands for turning lights on or off, e.g. activation delays, immediate response, switching lag
[C_99] Physical Installation Fit: How well the product physically fits into existing electrical boxes and mounting configurations, e.g. fitting in gang boxes, wire clearance, mounting depth requirements
[C_100] Smart Home Connectivity: How reliably the product connects to and communicates with home automation systems and hubs, e.g. Z-Wave connection, SmartThings integration, network stability
[C_101] Operational Noise Level: The amount of audible sound the product generates during normal operation, e.g. buzzing sounds, humming noise, clicking sounds
[C_102] Setup Complexity: How easy or difficult it is to install, configure, and program the product for use, e.g. wiring difficulty, programming simplicity, configuration options
[C_103] Manufacturing Quality: The consistency and condition of products as received from the manufacturer, e.g. defective units, used products shipped as new, broken components
[C_104] Physical Durability: How well the product's physical components withstand regular use and handling over time, e.g. rocker switches breaking, handles wearing out, mechanical failure
[C_105] Physical Installation: Ease and complexity of physically mounting and wiring the device during setup, e.g. straightforward wire setup, difficult alignment, orientation issues
[C_106] Smart Device Pairing: Initial connection process to establish communication between the device and smart home systems, e.g. instant pairing, failed pairing attempts, non-intuitive pairing mode
[C_107] Dimming Control: Quality and range of light intensity adjustment capabilities in dimmer switches, e.g. smooth dimming action, poor performance at low levels, humming when dimmed
[C_108] Physical Usability: Ease of physical interaction and operation for end users in daily use, e.g. low activation force, easy operation, appropriate toggle resistance
[C_109] Status Visibility: How clearly users can see the current state or position of the switch, e.g. easy to find in dark, difficult to tell switch position, LED visibility
[C_110] Advanced Smart Features: Specialized smart functionality beyond basic on/off control, e.g. power monitoring, double-tap sensing, acting as Zigbee repeater, LED control
[C_111] Multi-Way Configuration: Performance when used in three-way or multi-location switching setups, e.g. working as three-way switch, incompatibility with conventional three-way switches
[C_112] Lighting Quality: Impact on the quality of light output from connected fixtures, e.g. flickering issues, pulsating lights, smooth light transitions
[C_113] Basic Power Control: Core on/off switching functionality and power delivery reliability for standard lighting control, e.g. lights not turning on, switches failing to turn off, random power cycling, maintaining basic switch operation
[C_114] Light Fixture Compatibility: Performance with different bulb types and fixture configurations including unwanted electrical effects, e.g. LED flickering when off, compatibility with incandescent bulbs, voltage leakage to fixtures
[C_115] Physical Operation Feel: Tactile feedback and mechanical response quality during physical switch operation, e.g. solid click feel, smooth paddle action, button responsiveness, mechanical build quality
[C_116] LED Indicator Function: Built-in LED indicator performance including visibility, functionality, and reliability over time, e.g. indicator brightness adequacy, LED failure, location visibility in darkness
[C_117] Multi-Way Switch Operation: Performance in 3-way and multi-switch configurations for controlling lights from multiple locations, e.g. 3-way functionality loss, independent switch operation, multi-location control reliability
[C_118] Acoustic Performance: Sound-related characteristics during operation including unwanted noise generation, e.g. buzzing from connected lights, humming during dimming, silent operation quality
[C_119] Device Reliability: Customer experiences with product dependability and consistent operation over time, e.g. device freezing, failure after short periods, long-term reliability, defective units
[C_120] Power Control: Customer feedback about basic electrical switching and power management capabilities, e.g. light flickering, inability to turn off completely, power leakage, relay operation
[C_121] Physical Operation: Customer feedback about the tactile experience of using physical controls and switches, e.g. switch movement smoothness, clicking sounds, rocker feel, activation consistency
[C_122] Noise Performance: Customer feedback about unwanted sounds produced during operation, e.g. high-pitched whining, hissing sounds, loud clicking, mechanical noise
[C_123] Software Updates: Customer experiences with firmware and software maintenance, e.g. frequent unnecessary updates, firmware crashes, lack of update support
[C_124] Sound Detection Accuracy: How well the device recognizes and responds to intended sound triggers while filtering out unwanted noise, e.g. clap recognition sensitivity, background noise interference, proximity requirements
[C_125] False Activation Control: The device's ability to prevent unintended activation from non-target sounds or vibrations, e.g. TV noise triggering, cough detection, drawer closing activation
[C_126] Button Responsiveness: How quickly and consistently physical controls respond to user input, e.g. press latency, double-press requirements, immediate activation
[C_127] Dimming Range: The span of light intensity adjustment available from brightest to dimmest settings, e.g. minimum brightness levels, LED compatibility, adjustment granularity
[C_128] Dimming Function: The operational capability and quality of light level adjustment features, e.g. brightness levels available, flicker-free operation, control precision
[C_129] Voice Control Integration: Compatibility and responsiveness with voice assistant platforms for hands-free operation, e.g. Alexa commands, Google Assistant integration, voice recognition accuracy
[C_130] Mobile App Performance: The functionality and user experience of companion smartphone applications, e.g. setup ease, programming interface, app stability
[C_131] Remote Control Operation: The performance and reliability of wireless remote control functionality, e.g. range effectiveness, button response, signal reliability
[C_132] Magnetic Attachment: The effectiveness of magnetic mounting systems for securing remote controls or accessories, e.g. hold strength, positioning stability, magnetic interference
[C_133] Battery Performance: The longevity and reliability of battery-powered device operation, e.g. charge duration, replacement frequency, power management
[C_134] Installation Compatibility: How well the device fits standard electrical configurations and installation requirements, e.g. wiring compatibility, mounting differences, setup complexity
[C_135] Long Term Reliability: Consistent performance and functionality over extended periods of use, e.g. multi-year operation, performance degradation, failure patterns
[C_136] Product Defect Rate: The frequency of non-functional or faulty units received by customers, e.g. dead on arrival, manufacturing defects, batch quality issues
[C_137] Tactile Feedback: Customer experience with the physical feel and responsiveness when operating the switch, e.g. soft switch feel, mushy feel, crisp tactile feel, requires firm press
[C_138] Sound Level: Customer feedback about noise produced during switch operation, e.g. quiet operation, loud click, no clicking sound, humming noise
[C_139] Dimming Speed: Customer experience with how fast or slow the dimming transition occurs, e.g. slow dimming with no instant on/off, fades slowly to off
[C_140] Hub Connectivity: Customer experience connecting the switch to smart home hubs and Z-wave systems, e.g. works great with SmartThings hub, will not connect to hub
[C_141] Memory Function: Customer feedback about the switch's ability to remember previous settings, e.g. remembers last dimmer setting, defaults to OFF when power applied
[C_142] Configuration Options: Customer experience with available customization and programming features, e.g. limited configuration options, supports pre-staging on-level programming
[C_143] Short Term Reliability: Customer reports of product failures or issues within the first few months of use, e.g. failed after 2 weeks, quit working after 4 months, broke after one month
[C_144] Cleanability: Customer experience with cleaning and maintaining the switch appearance, e.g. difficult to clean, collects dirt and grime
[C_145] System Integration: Ability to connect and work properly with smart home systems and automation platforms, e.g. HomeAssistant compatibility, Z-wave connectivity, hub pairing
[C_146] User Interface Responsiveness: Speed and reliability of user interactions with the device controls, e.g. touch response delays, switching delays, control sensitivity
[C_147] Setup and Configuration: Initial device pairing, network setup, and configuration processes, e.g. pairing ease, setup time, configuration options
[C_148] Customer Support Quality: Quality and responsiveness of manufacturer support services, e.g. support response times, documentation quality, technical assistance
[C_149] Value Proposition: Cost-effectiveness and pricing considerations relative to product performance, e.g. price comparisons, value for money assessments
[C_150] Switch Operation Feel: Aspects related to the tactile experience and mechanical smoothness of operating the physical switch, e.g. smooth switching, positive click, sliding feel, crisp operation
[C_151] Audible Noise Problems: Aspects related to unwanted sounds produced by the switch during operation, e.g. buzzing sounds, weird noises, humming, sound like flies
[C_152] Three Way Switch Function: Aspects specifically related to three-way switch operation and performance, e.g. 3-way switching working, requiring multiple toggles, wiring complications for 3-way
[C_153] Smart Features Responsiveness: Aspects related to how well smart features like app control, voice commands, and scheduling respond and function, e.g. responsive to app, voice command issues, scheduling problems
[C_154] Installation Complexity: Aspects related to the difficulty or ease of physically installing switches, including wiring challenges, fitting into electrical boxes, and overall installation process, e.g. difficult to install, easy installation, fitting into electrical box challenges
[C_155] Wire Connection Issues: Problems specifically with connecting, securing, or managing wires during installation, including wire gauge compatibility and connection mechanisms, e.g. wire clamp tightness, screw spinning without securing wire, wire insertion difficulties
[C_156] Smart Connectivity Performance: Performance of wireless connectivity features including WiFi connection stability, smart home integration, and network communication reliability, e.g. WiFi disconnection issues, smart home integration, network pairing problems
[C_157] Electrical Behavior Issues: Abnormal electrical characteristics or safety concerns including voltage leakage, current flow problems, and electrical interference, e.g. voltage on neutral line, current in off position, electrical interference
[C_158] Sensor Performance: Functionality of motion detection, light sensing, and other automated sensing features, e.g. motion detector accuracy, photocell sensitivity, day/night sensor performance
[C_159] Light Output Quality: Characteristics of illumination provided by switches with integrated lighting, including brightness levels and light direction, e.g. LED brightness, light direction control, illumination adequacy
[C_160] Design Flexibility: Versatility in installation options, mounting configurations, and usage scenarios, e.g. multiple pole configurations, portable mounting options, installation flexibility
[C_161] Electrical Compatibility: How well the product works with different electrical configurations, lighting types, and other electrical components, e.g. LED compatibility, 3-way circuits, voltage requirements
[C_162] Switch Responsiveness: The tactile feel and mechanical response of the switch operation including click quality and smoothness, e.g. positive click, smooth action, definitive feedback
[C_163] User Interface Design: Ease of use and intuitiveness of physical controls and interface elements, e.g. clear interface, user-friendly design, easy navigation
[C_164] Safety Performance: Fire hazards, overheating, and electrical safety concerns during operation, e.g. overheating issues, fire hazards, electrical sparking
[C_165] Visual Indicators: Visibility features and status indication capabilities of the device, e.g. nightlight function, status LEDs, visibility in dark conditions
[C_166] Operational Consistency: Reliability of the switch to perform its intended function when activated, e.g. working intermittently, consistent operation every time, high failure rates
[C_167] Multi Way Operation: Functionality when used in 3-way switch configurations with multiple control points, e.g. compatibility with dumb switches, proper 3-way behavior
[C_168] Audible Noise: Unwanted sounds produced during switch operation or while in use, e.g. clicking noises, buzzing during dimming, loud switching sounds
[C_169] Settings Memory: Ability to remember and restore previous dimming levels and configurations, e.g. returning to last dimming setting after power cycle
[C_170] Sensor Functionality: Performance of light sensors and automatic activation features, e.g. ambient light detection, motion sensing accuracy, nightlight operation
[C_171] Product Defects: Manufacturing flaws and out-of-box failures that prevent normal operation, e.g. dead on arrival units, electrical shorts, complete non-functionality from purchase
[C_172] Initial Setup: First-time device configuration and pairing process with networks and systems, e.g. hub connection speed, app setup difficulty, device pairing complexity
[C_173] Device Durability: Long-term physical and operational lifespan under normal usage conditions, e.g. years of reliable service, resistance to wear, expected brand longevity
[C_174] Customization Options: Availability and ease of personalizing device settings and appearance, e.g. programmable features, interface lighting options, button configuration flexibility
[C_175] Product Reliability: Aspects related to consistent product functionality and operational dependability over time, e.g. device lockups, unresponsiveness, premature failures, switches stopping working
[C_176] Multi Switch Configuration: Aspects related to performance in three-way switch setups and multi-switch installations, e.g. 3-way operation consistency, switch coordination, setting maintenance
[C_177] LED Bulb Compatibility: Aspects related to performance specifically with LED lighting loads, e.g. LED flickering, buzzing with LEDs, LED load handling
[C_178] Cross Talk Issues: Aspects related to unwanted interference between multiple switches or circuits, e.g. switches affecting each other, unintended dimming, signal interference
[C_179] Product Visibility: Aspects related to the visual accessibility and findability of switches in various lighting conditions, e.g. dark room visibility, side visibility
[C_180] Product Lifespan: Customer feedback about how long the product continues to function before failure or degradation, e.g. failed after 18 months, lasted 12 years, stopped working after 2 days
[C_181] Switch Physical Feel: Customer experiences with the tactile quality and mechanical operation of the physical switch components, e.g. loose and cheap feel, satisfying click, smooth operation
[C_182] Noise Generation: Customer experiences with sounds produced by the device during operation, e.g. humming when dimmed, silent operation, buzzing problems
[C_183] Smart Device Compatibility: Integration and performance with smart home ecosystems and voice assistants, e.g. works well with Alexa, compatible with Apple HomeKit, works with Lutron Aurora
[C_184] App Performance: Functionality and reliability of companion mobile applications for smart switches, e.g. app works flawlessly, MyLeviton app connection automatic
[C_185] Switch Mechanism Reliability: Reliability of the physical switching mechanism including toggle and button responsiveness, e.g. on-off toggle fails frequently, switch stops catching, requires multiple presses
[C_186] Physical Deterioration: Physical breakdown of product materials and housing over time, e.g. switches crack, fall apart during installation
[C_187] Batch Failure Rates: Patterns of multiple product failures within purchased sets or over time periods, e.g. all fail in less than a year, 4 out of 6 failed, 10 percent failure rate
[C_188] Build Quality Perception: Customer assessment of the physical construction and materials quality of the switch, e.g. feels cheap, flimsy construction, mushy feeling, poor quality materials
[C_189] Smart Features Setup: Ease of configuring smart functionality and connecting to apps or networks, e.g. quick app setup, easy Alexa integration, WiFi connection difficulties
[C_190] App Control Performance: Functionality of smartphone app control and remote operation capabilities, e.g. app commands work properly, remote control features, grouping abilities
[C_191] Visual Appeal: Customer satisfaction with the aesthetic appearance and design of the switch, e.g. looks great, attractive design, visual integration with decor
[C_192] Physical Construction Quality: Customer feedback about the structural integrity and build quality of switch components, e.g. paddle rockers coming loose, switches falling apart with minimal use, or being sturdy and reliable
[C_193] Dimming Control Performance: Customer feedback specifically about dimming capabilities and light level adjustment quality, e.g. smooth dimming without flickering, effective brightness range control, or dimming malfunctions and flutter
[C_194] Network Connection Stability: Customer experiences with maintaining stable WiFi and internet connectivity over time, e.g. switches losing connection after months, disconnecting frequently, or maintaining consistent network access
[C_195] System Response Speed: Customer experiences with how quickly switches respond to commands and inputs, e.g. delays between button presses and activation, slow app response times, or ultra-responsive controls
[C_196] Physical Switch Controls: Customer feedback about manual button and paddle operation independent of smart features, e.g. physical switches not responding while app works, manual operation failures, or reliable tactile controls
[C_197] Initial Setup Experience: Customer experiences with first-time configuration and pairing processes, e.g. nightmare setup experiences, challenging app connections, or straightforward installation procedures
[C_198] Physical Installation Process: Customer feedback about the mechanical installation into wall boxes and electrical connections, e.g. fitting issues with gang boxes, neutral wire complications, or smooth mounting experiences
[C_199] Advanced Configuration Options: Customer feedback about customizable settings and programmable features, e.g. setting minimum/maximum light levels, programming presets, or adjustable dimming ranges
[C_200] Multi Switch Coordination: Customer experiences with three-way switch setups and multiple switch installations, e.g. inability to link switches for hallway control or three-way dimmer functionality issues
[C_201] System Responsiveness: Aspects concerning the speed and reliability of switch response to commands from various control methods, e.g. paddle press response, Z-Wave command response, lag issues
[C_202] Status Accuracy: Aspects related to the switch correctly reporting and maintaining its current state across different control interfaces, e.g. app status mismatches, manual switch detection, state synchronization
[C_203] Light Quality Issues: Aspects concerning unwanted visual or auditory effects during switch operation, e.g. LED flickering, electrical buzzing, humming noises
[C_204] User Interface Visibility: Aspects related to the visibility and illumination of switch indicators and controls in various lighting conditions, e.g. switch visibility in dark rooms, indicator brightness levels
[C_205] Visual Design Integration: Aspects related to how well the switch appearance integrates with existing home decor and other switches, e.g. color matching, aesthetic blending, visual consistency
[C_206] Firmware Management: Aspects concerning software updates and firmware-related functionality improvements or issues, e.g. firmware update processes, stability improvements, update reliability
[C_207] Memory and Configuration: Aspects related to the switch remembering settings and maintaining user preferences across power cycles, e.g. brightness level memory, configuration retention, parameter settings
[C_208] Physical Build Quality: Aspects related to the tactile feel, construction quality, and physical robustness of the device, e.g. cheap feeling operation, flimsy feel on wall, solid construction
[C_209] Aesthetic Integration: Aspects related to visual appearance and how well the device matches existing decor and fixtures, e.g. color matching with outlet covers, modern appearance, fingerprint resistance
[C_210] Tactile Operation: Customer experience with the physical feel and force required when operating the product controls, e.g. smooth operation, needing to press hard, feeling nice when operating
[C_211] Illumination Performance: Customer feedback about the brightness and lighting quality provided by the product's indicator lights or illumination features, e.g. very dim, excellent lighting, hard to see, full brightness
[C_212] Functional Reliability: Customer feedback about consistent day-to-day operation and whether the product performs its intended functions dependably, e.g. switches dying, working flawlessly, turning on automatically, high failure rates
[C_213] Smart Device Connectivity: Aspects related to connecting and maintaining connections with smart home platforms and wireless networks, e.g. WiFi connectivity, Alexa pairing, network stability
[C_214] Current Leakage: Aspects related to unwanted electrical current flow when switches are in off position, e.g. LEDs glowing when off, phantom loads
[C_215] Power Handling: Aspects related to the switch's ability to handle electrical loads and voltage requirements, e.g. wattage capacity, voltage drops under load
[C_216] Circuit Configuration: Aspects related to compatibility with different wiring configurations and circuit types, e.g. 3-way wiring, multi-switch circuits
[C_217] Core Switch Operation: Basic on/off switching functionality and mechanical operation, e.g. manual control, switch toggling, physical button response
[C_218] Audio Feedback: Sound characteristics during switch operation, e.g. clicking noise, operational quietness, audible feedback
[C_219] Hardware Components: Quality and performance of physical hardware elements, e.g. screw quality, mounting components, hardware integrity
[C_220] Electrical Capacity: Power handling capabilities and electrical performance limits, e.g. wattage ratings, motor compatibility, load capacity
[C_221] Built-in Lighting: Performance of integrated LED indicators or night lights, e.g. illumination quality, light sensitivity, indicator brightness
[C_222] Safety Concerns: Product safety issues and potential hazards, e.g. fire risks, electrical safety, hazardous malfunctions
[C_223] Memory Functions: Ability to remember and restore previous settings, e.g. dimming level memory, setting retention
[C_224] Physical Switch Reliability: Performance of manual/physical switch operation including responsiveness and mechanical durability, e.g. switch not responding, physical buttons failing, mechanical wear
[C_225] Remote Control Functionality: Performance of app-based and voice control features when physical controls fail or work normally, e.g. Alexa control, WiFi control, app responsiveness
[C_226] Device Status and Communication: How well the device communicates its status and maintains connection with control systems, e.g. showing offline, status lights, app connectivity
[C_227] User Interface Experience: Quality and usability of mobile apps and control interfaces, e.g. intuitive apps, confusing interfaces, language display issues
[C_228] Dimming Range and Precision: Quality of light dimming control including range, smoothness, and adjustment capabilities, e.g. wide dimming range, precise control, linear dimming
[C_229] Installation Space Requirements: Physical space challenges during installation including box fit and wire management, e.g. tight electrical boxes, wire space issues, housing size
[C_230] Installation Process Difficulty: Ease or complexity of the installation procedure including instructions and setup requirements, e.g. straightforward installation, wiring complexity, setup challenges
[C_231] Brand and Device Compatibility: Interoperability with other manufacturers' devices and smart home systems, e.g. works only with same brand, cross-manufacturer compatibility
[C_232] Multi-Circuit Control: Ability to control multiple lighting circuits or complex wiring configurations, e.g. 3-way installation, separate circuit control, single pole operation
[C_233] Transformer Compatibility: Performance with different types of electrical transformers and low voltage systems, e.g. electronic transformers, magnetic transformers, low voltage LED fixtures
[C_234] Light Output Control: Issues with complete light shutoff and minimum brightness levels, e.g. lights not turning completely off, residual glow, minimum brightness problems
[C_235] Setup Instructions: Quality and clarity of provided setup documentation and guidance, e.g. instructions are inaccurate, instructions were very clear, lacking detail
[C_236] Switch Position Clarity: Ability to easily determine the current on/off state of the switch through visual or tactile feedback, e.g. difficult to realize switch is on or off
[C_237] Basic Switching Operation: Core on/off switching functionality and responsiveness, e.g. turns lights on and off as expected, slow to respond, does not turn on/off without precise pressing
[C_238] Smart Device Programming: Initial setup and configuration of smart features and connectivity, e.g. programming is fairly simple, could not be programmed without internet access, pairing was challenging
[C_239] LED Light Compatibility: Performance specifically with LED lighting systems and fixtures, e.g. eliminates LED flicker, works well with various LED fixtures, will not work well with non-dimmable bulbs
[C_240] Circuit Configuration Support: Ability to work in different wiring configurations and setups, e.g. works single pole and 3-way, 3-way control didn't work, works in standard or 3-way configuration
[C_241] Operational Noise Levels: Sound generation during normal operation, e.g. makes high pitch buzzing noise, quiet operating, doesn't cure buzzing with LED lights
[C_242] Night Visibility: Illumination features for locating and using switches in dark conditions, e.g. night light allows switch to be seen in dark, light helps find wall switch at night, light not bright enough to see way into room


**CATEGORIZATION GUIDELINES:**
1. **Business Focus**: Think about what categories would be most valuable for business teams
2. **Customer Impact**: Consider how these aspects affect customer experience and satisfaction
3. **Strategic Value**: Choose categories that help prioritize product improvements and business decisions
4. **Clear Boundaries**: Each aspect should fit clearly into one category with no ambiguity
5. **OUT_OF_SCOPE Usage**: Use only for aspects that are truly unclear, too generic, or don't fit any meaningful category

**REQUIRED OUTPUT FORMAT:**
Return pure JSON mapping each aspect ID to its category ID:
{
  "1": "C_0",
  "2": "C_1", 
  "3": "OUT_OF_SCOPE",
  "4": "C_2",
  ...
}

**CRITICAL RULES:**
- **Complete Coverage**: Every aspect ID from the input must appear exactly once in the output
- **Valid Category IDs**: Use only the category IDs provided (C_0, C_1, etc.) or "OUT_OF_SCOPE"
- **Pure JSON**: Return only the JSON object - no explanations or formatting
- **No Duplicates**: Each aspect ID should appear exactly once
- **Strategic Thinking**: Consider business and customer value when making assignments



**PRODUCT CATEGORIES IN DATASET:** Dimmer Switches, Light Switches
Consider how performance aspects relate to customer needs across these 2 product categories.
